definitions.definition: Dejection or depression; something that spoils a positive emotion (such as enjoyment, satisfaction, expectation or courage) or a desired activity.
A gaseous product, formed in coal mines, old wells, pits, etc.
To dampen; to make moderately wet
To put out, as fire; to weaken, restrain, or make dull.
To suppress vibrations (mechanical) or oscillations (electrical) by converting energy to heat (or some other form of energy).
In a state between dry and wet; moderately wet; moist.
definitions.example: The lawn was still damp so we decided not to sit down.

definitions.definition: Permitting the possession of alcoholic beverages, but not their sale.
